title_sort: charles wells moulton to walt whitman, 28 november 1888
title: Charles Wells Moulton to Walt Whitman, 28 November 1888
text: The Magazine of PoetryC.W. Moulton,EditorDICTATEDBuffalo, N.Y.November 28th 1888Mr. Walt WhitmanCamden, N.J.Dear Sir:â€”Sometime since I wrote you concerning a selection from your poems which I wished to publish in the first number of the Magazine of Poetry. Dr. Buckle of London, Ont., has kindly furnished a biographical notice of yourself, and with your permission, I would like to make the selections from your poems. I enclose letter from your publisher in which Mr. McKay expresses his approval of our new magazine.Trusting to hear from you at your early convenience, I remain,Yours very respectfully,C. W. Moulton(L.M)answered Dec 1 '88 by HLT.See notes Nov 30, '88. Charles Wells Moulton to Walt Whitman, 28 November 1888
